titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Hatchett, Indictment
CWG5316

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Washington Circuit Court
William Hatchett

The Grand Jury of Washington county in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Hatchett of the crime of Robbery committed as follows: The Said William Hatchett on the 1st day of December 1865 in the County aforesaid Washington did feloniously steal take and cary away one Pistol of the Value of Ten Dollars, One mans Saddle of the Value of Twelve Dollars the personal property goods and chattels of James I. Reed from his person & presence by force and against his will by putting him in fear of Some immediate injury to his person against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Ky Witnesses before the Jury
James I. Reed, George Lambert George Baker Morrison Harber Andrew Pinkston John McMillen and H. D. Reed

L. H. Noble Atty for
Commonwealth
a Copy att
W. H. Phillips D. C.
Comwlth
vs } Robbery
Wm. Hatchetta true bill
D. McIlvoy foreman of the Grand Jury
a Copy
Att.
W. H Phillips
